verses.devanagari: लोमहर्षणपुत्र उग्रश्रवाः सूतः पौराणिको नैमिषारण्ये शौनकस्य कुलपतेर्द्वादशवार्षिके सत्रे ॥ १ ॥
verses.iast: lomaharṣaṇaputra ugraśravāḥ sūtaḥ paurāṇiko naimiṣāraṇye śaunakasya kulapater dvādaśavārṣike satre || 1 ||
verses.translation: At the twelve-year sacrificial session of Śaunaka, lord of the family, in Naimiṣāraṇya, there was present Ugraśravas Sauti, son of Lomaharṣaṇa, a bard expert in the Purāṇas.

verses.iast: samāsīnān abhyagacchad brahmarṣīn saṃśita-vratān | vinayāvanato bhūtvā kadācit sūta-nandanaḥ || 2 ||
verses.translation: Once, the Sūta’s son approached the Brahmarṣis, resolute in their vows, as they sat; he came with humble deference.

verses.devanagari: तमाश्रममनुप्राप्तं नैमिषारण्यवासिनः । चित्राः श्रोतुं कथास्तत्र परिवव्रुस्तपस्विनः ॥ ३ ॥
verses.iast: tam āśramam anuprāptaṃ naimiṣāraṇya-vāsinaḥ | citrāḥ śrotuṃ kathās tatra parivavruḥ tapasvinaḥ || 3 ||
verses.translation: When he reached the hermitage, the ascetics dwelling in Naimiṣāraṇya gathered there, wishing to hear wondrous tales.

verses.devanagari: अभिवाद्य मुनींस्तांस्तु सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलिः । अपृच्छत्स तपोवृद्धिं सद्भिश्चैवाभिनन्दितः ॥ ४ ॥
verses.iast: abhivādya munīṃs tān tu sarvān eva kṛtāñjaliḥ | apṛcchata tapo-vṛddhiṃ sadbhiś caivābhinanditaḥ || 4 ||
verses.translation: With palms joined, he saluted all the sages, inquired after the increase of their austerities, and was graciously received by the good.

verses.devanagari: अथ तेषूपविष्टेषु सर्वेष्वेव तपस्विषु । निर्दिष्टमासनं भेजे विनयाल्लोमहर्षणिः ॥ ५ ॥
verses.iast: atha teṣūpaviṣṭeṣu sarveṣv eva tapasviṣu | nirdiṣṭam āsanaṃ bheje vinayāl lomaharṣaṇiḥ || 5 ||
verses.translation: When all the ascetics were seated, Lomaharṣaṇa’s son, out of deference, took the seat that had been indicated.

verses.devanagari: सुखासीनं ततस्तं तु विश्रान्तमुपलक्ष्य च । अथापृच्छदृषिस्तत्र कश्चित्प्रस्तावयन्कथाः ॥ ६ ॥
verses.iast: sukhāsīnaṃ tataḥ taṃ tu viśrāntam upalakṣya ca | athāpṛcchad ṛṣis tatra kaścit prastāvayan kathāḥ || 6 ||
verses.translation: Perceiving him to be comfortably seated and at ease, a certain sage there questioned him, initiating the conversation.

verses.devanagari: कुत आगम्यते सौते क्व चायं विहृतस्त्वया । कालः कमलपत्राक्ष शंसैतत्पृच्छतो मम ॥ ७ ॥
verses.iast: kuta āgamyate saute kva cāyaṃ vihṛtas tvayā | kālaḥ kamalapatrākṣa śaṃsa etat pṛcchato mama || 7 ||
verses.translation: “From where do you come, O Sūta? Where have you wandered? Pray, lotus-eyed one, tell me these things as I ask.”

verses.devanagari: सूत उवाच । जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः सर्पसत्रे महात्मनः । समीपे पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य सम्यक्पारिक्षितस्य च ॥ ८ ॥
verses.iast: sūta uvāca | janamejayasya rājarṣeḥ sarpa-satre mahātmanaḥ | samīpe pārthivendrasya samyak-pārikṣitasya ca || 8 ||
verses.translation: The Sūta said: “At the great snake-sacrifice of the royal sage Janamejaya, in the presence of that lord among kings, the scion of Parīkṣit…”

verses.devanagari: कृष्णद्वैपायनप्रोक्ताः सुपुण्या विविधाः कथाः । कथिताश्चापि विधिवद्या वैशंपायनेन वै ॥ ९ ॥
verses.iast: kṛṣṇa-dvaipāyana-proktāḥ supuṇyā vividhāḥ kathāḥ | kathitāś cāpi vidhivad yā vaiśaṃpāyanena vai || 9 ||
verses.translation: —the various most holy narratives composed by Kṛṣṇa-Dvaipāyana (Vyāsa) and duly recited by Vaiśaṃpāyana.

verses.devanagari: श्रुत्वाहं ता विचित्रार्था महाभारतसंश्रिताः । बहूनि संपरिक्रम्य तीर्थान्यायतनानि च ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast: śrutvā ahaṃ tā vicitrārthā mahābhārata-saṃśritāḥ | bahūni saṃparikramya tīrthāny āyatanāni ca || 10 ||
verses.translation: Having listened to those various Mahābhārata tales, I journeyed widely to many sacred fords and sanctuaries.
